page.title: 10Education in Knypersley.
page.content: From the age of five children attend a primary school in the area,where they are taught to read and write.When they are nine they move to Park Middle School where the courses available are more varied and detailed to include the arts and sciences. At the age of thirteen the children progress to the High School.In their first year pupils are given a general education to enable them at the end of the year to choose their examination subjects (either C.S.E,"O" level,or 16+).At the age of sixteen pupils can leave school having taken examinations or not.Alternatively they can stay on in the Sixth Form to further their education.Courses here include; exam re-takes,extra "O"levels, "A"levels,and the recently introduced C.P.V.E.which involves work experience combined with academic study.
